page.title: 08SUTTON CHENEY ARCHITECTURE
page.content:
Sutton Cheney is, in the main comprised of old but well preserved and maintained property, which combines to produce the typical picturesque aspect of a traditional South Leicestershire village.
St. James Church is mainly 14th century with a 13th century arcade. Inside the church is a monument to Sir William Roberts, who in 1613 was responsible for the construction of Hall Farm, an imposing two storey red brick mansion.
Sir William was also founder of the Alms Houses, built in 1612 as a row of single storey stone cottages and extended in the 19th century by the addition of an attic. The south end gable still carries the nest holes from a formerly attached dovecote.
